SENT.plain: We investigated the MRI appearance of the optic nerve and its cerebrospinal-fluid-containing sheath in 17 patients with benign intracranial hypertension (BIH) and 15 normal controls
Using phased-array local coils, 3-mm coronal T2-weighted fat-suppressed fast spin-echo images were obtained with an in-plane resolution of < 0.39 mm
The optic nerve and its sheath were clearly differentiated
An enlarged, elongated subarachnoid space around the optic nerve was demonstrated in patients with BIH
High-resolution MRI of the optic nerve offers additional information which may be of value for diagnosis and in planning and monitoring treatment
